function_arguments.document_code:
from docx.shared import Pt, Inches
from docx.enum.style import WD_STYLE_TYPE
from docx.enum.text import WD_ALIGN_PARAGRAPH
from docx.enum.table import WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT
import matplotlib.patches as mpatches
import datetime as dt
import matplotlib.dates as mdates

styles = doc.styles

# Normal style
normal = styles['Normal']
normal.font.name = 'Calibri'
normal.font.size = Pt(11)

# Headings
styles['Heading 1'].font.name = 'Calibri'
styles['Heading 1'].font.size = Pt(18)
styles['Heading 1'].font.bold = True
styles['Heading 2'].font.name = 'Calibri'
styles['Heading 2'].font.size = Pt(14)
styles['Heading 2'].font.bold = True
styles['Heading 3'].font.name = 'Calibri'
styles['Heading 3'].font.size = Pt(12)
styles['Heading 3'].font.bold = True
styles['Title'].font.name = 'Calibri'
styles['Title'].font.size = Pt(26)
styles['Title'].font.bold = True

# Caption style
if 'Caption' not in [s.name for s in styles]:
    cap = styles.add_style('Caption', WD_STYLE_TYPE.PARAGRAPH)
    cap.font.name = 'Calibri'
    cap.font.size = Pt(9)
    cap.font.italic = True

def add_caption(text):
    p = doc.add_paragraph(text, style='Caption')
    p.alignment = WD_ALIGN_PARAGRAPH.CENTER
    return p

# Title Page

doc.add_heading('Kastle Systems ERP Modernization Proposal', level=0)
para = doc.add_paragraph('Prepared for: Kastle Systems')
para.paragraph_format.space_after = Pt(18)
para = doc.add_paragraph('Submitted by: [Vendor Company Name]', style='Normal')
para.paragraph_format.space_after = Pt(18)
doc.add_paragraph('Confidential: External use or disclosure of any information contained in this document without written permission is prohibited.', style='Normal')
doc.add_page_break()

# Letter of Transmittal
from datetime import date
today = date.today().strftime('%B %d, %Y')
doc.add_paragraph(f'{today}', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Letter of Transmittal to Kastle Systems', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Re: Kastle Systems ERP Modernization RFP', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('To whom it may concern, this response to the Kastle Systems RFP is hereby submitted by [Vendor Company Name]:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Submitted by:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('[Vendor Company Name]', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('6100 West Plano Parkway', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Suite 1800, Plano, Texas 75093', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Attn: Legal: [Authorized Officer Name]', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Vendor Contact Information:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('SAM/CSM Name, Position, Phone No., Email', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('DSE/DCE Name, Position, Phone No., Email', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Kastle Contact Information:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Name:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Title:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Phone:', style='Normal')
doc.add_paragraph('Email:', style='Normal')
doc.add_page_break()

# Table of Contents
contents = [
    '1 Executive Summary',
    '2 Company Overview',
    '3 Service Capabilities',
    '4 Implementation Plan and Details',
    '5 Proposed Timeline',
    '6 Project Management and Governance',
    '7 Security, Privacy, and Compliance',
    '8 Team and Qualifications',
    '9 Assumptions, Risks, and Dependencies',
    '10 Pricing Proposal',
    '11 Client References',
    '12 Appendices',
]
doc.add_heading('TABLE OF CONTENTS', level=1)
for item in contents:
    doc.add_paragraph(item, style='Normal')
doc.add_page_break()

# Executive Summary

doc.add_heading('Executive Summary', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Kastle Systems seeks an experienced implementation partner to modernize its ERP and Field Service systems. '
    'Our proposal addresses Kastle’s requirements for end-to-end implementation, integration across business platforms, rigorous training, data migration, and ongoing managed services. '
    'We deliver cost-effective, scalable, and secure solutions leveraging deep Microsoft Dynamics expertise and proven delivery methodology.'
)
para.paragraph_format.space_after = Pt(12)

# Strategic Goals Table
str_goals = [
    ('Single ERP application for consolidated operations and reporting', 'Internal productivity increase'),
    ('Increased inventory and shipping visibility', 'Improved management of supply chain and orders'),
    ('Less IT maintenance and licensing costs', 'IT can free up bandwidth to work on other projects'),
]
table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=2)
table.style = 'Table Grid'
table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Strategic Goals'
hdr[1].text = 'Measures of Success'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
for goal, measure in str_goals:
    row = table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = goal
    row[1].text = measure

doc.add_paragraph('Our methodology brings strong discipline to ensure a successful implementation and eventual client ownership of the system. The proposed implementation timeline is below.')

# Insert Gantt Chart
schedule = pd.DataFrame({
    'Task': [
        'Project Initiation', 'Requirements Analysis', 'Solution Design', 'Development', 'Integration', 'Testing', 'User Training', 'Deployment', 'Hypercare Support'
    ],
    'Team': [
        'Management', 'Business Analysts', 'Architects', 'Development', 'Integration', 'QA Team', 'Training', 'DevOps', 'Support'
    ],
    'Start': pd.to_datetime([
        '2026-02-15', '2026-02-22', '2026-03-07', '2026-03-21', '2026-04-15', '2026-05-01', '2026-05-15', '2026-06-01', '2026-06-15'
    ]),
    'End': pd.to_datetime([
        '2026-02-21', '2026-03-06', '2026-03-20', '2026-04-14', '2026-04-30', '2026-05-14', '2026-05-31', '2026-06-14', '2026-07-05'
    ])
})
project_start = schedule['Start'].min()
schedule['days_to_start'] = (schedule['Start'] - project_start).dt.days
schedule['duration'] = (schedule['End'] - schedule['Start']).dt.days + 1
team_colors = {
    'Management': '#34495e',
    'Business Analysts': '#3498db',
    'Architects': '#9b59b6',
    'Development': '#2ecc71',
    'Integration': '#e67e22',
    'QA Team': '#e74c3c',
    'Training': '#f39c12',
    'DevOps': '#1abc9c',
    'Support': '#7f8c8d'
}
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 5.5))
for idx, row in schedule.iterrows():
    ax.barh(y=row['Task'], width=row['duration'], left=row['days_to_start'], color=team_colors[row['Team']], edgecolor='white', linewidth=0.5)
ax.invert_yaxis()
max_days = schedule['days_to_start'].max() + schedule['duration'].max()
exticks = np.arange(0, max_days + 7, 14)
exticklabels = pd.date_range(start=project_start, periods=len(xticks), freq='14D').strftime('%b %d')
ax.set_xticks(xticks[:len(xticklabels)])
ax.set_xticklabels(xticklabels, fontsize=9)
ax.set_xlabel('Timeline', fontsize=10)
ax.set_title('Project Implementation Schedule', fontsize=14, fontweight='bold')
ax.xaxis.grid(True, alpha=0.3, linestyle='--')
ax.set_axisbelow(True)
unique_teams = schedule['Team'].unique()
patches = [mpatches.Patch(color=team_colors[team], label=team) for team in unique_teams]
ax.legend(handles=patches, loc='lower right', fontsize=8, framealpha=0.9)
plt.tight_layout()
gantt_path = output_dir / 'kastle_gantt.png'
plt.savefig(gantt_path, dpi=150, bbox_inches='tight', facecolor='white')
plt.close()
doc.add_picture(str(gantt_path), width=Inches(5.8))
add_caption('Figure 1: Proposed implementation schedule by phase and team')

doc.add_page_break()

# Company Overview

doc.add_heading('Company Overview', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    '[Vendor Company Name] is a global consulting firm and top-ranked Microsoft Dynamics Gold Certified Partner specializing in digital transformation for organizations across industries. Our expert consultants deliver strategic advisory, implementation services, technical support, managed services, and packaged solutions leveraging Microsoft Dynamics ERP, CRM, BI/Analytics, Power Platform, and other Microsoft cloud solutions.'
)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'As a member of Microsoft’s Inner Circle and winner of US Partner of the Year for Dynamics 365 Finance, we excel in global implementations with complex business processes. Our ERP team specializes in delivering solutions to manufacturing, distribution, and service organizations, aligning with strategic objectives to reengineer and optimize operations.'
)
para = doc.add_paragraph('Our company embodies the following differentiators:')
doc.add_paragraph('Success in implementing and supporting full ERP solutions across multiple industries', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('Deep experience migrating clients from legacy Dynamics AX to Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('Credentialed, experienced consultants leveraging industry best practices', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('Agile, iterative methodology for rapid customer ownership and cost efficiency', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('Executive commitment to client outcomes and partnership', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_page_break()

# Service Capabilities

doc.add_heading('Service Capabilities', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Our services cover the full project lifecycle, including requirements analysis, solution design, implementation, integration, ongoing training, managed services, maintenance, user training, and transparent cost breakdowns. We address all key business functions for ERP modernization.'
)

# Business Functions Table
functions = [
    'General Accounting', 'Business Decision Support', 'Lead to Cash', 'Project Management',
    'Service', 'Procure to Pay', 'Inventory Management', 'Warehouse Management'
]
table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=1)
table.style = 'Table Grid'
table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Supported ERP Functional Areas'
for run in hdr[0].paragraphs[0].runs:
    run.bold = True
for f in functions:
    row = table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = f

doc.add_paragraph('Our scope includes both remote and on-site services as required, with all travel pre-approved and compliant with relevant policies.')
doc.add_page_break()

# Implementation Plan and Details

doc.add_heading('Implementation Plan and Details', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Our project approach follows a proven Agile methodology based on Microsoft Dynamics Sure Step, organized into five phases: Project Initiation, Analyze, Design & Develop, Deploy, and Optimize.'
)

mermaid_code = '''
flowchart TD
  INIT[Initiation] --> ANALYZE[Analyze]
  ANALYZE --> DESIGN[Design & Develop]
  DESIGN --> DEPLOY[Deploy]
  DEPLOY --> OPTIMIZE[Optimize]
  INIT --> GOV[Governance]
  ANALYZE --> DATA[Data Migration]
  DESIGN --> TRAIN[Training]
  DEPLOY --> UAT[User Acceptance Testing]
  OPTIMIZE --> SUPPORT[Managed Services]
'''
diagram_path = render_mermaid(mermaid_code, 'implementation_workflow')
doc.add_picture(str(diagram_path), width=Inches(5.8))
add_caption('Figure 2: Modernization project workflow overview')

# Implementation Phases Table
phases = [
    ('Project Initiation', 'Kick-off, management plan, environment setup'),
    ('Analyze', 'Requirements workshops, scope confirmation, gap analysis'),
    ('Design & Develop', 'Solution design, configuration, integration, testing, migration, training'),
    ('Deploy', 'Final data migration, production setup, UAT, go-live'),
    ('Optimize', 'Post-go-live support, solution tuning, managed services')
]
table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=2)
table.style = 'Table Grid'
table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Phase'
hdr[1].text = 'Key Activities'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
for phase, act in phases:
    row = table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = phase
    row[1].text = act

doc.add_page_break()

# Project Management and Governance

doc.add_heading('Project Management and Governance', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Effective project management and governance is critical for Kastle’s ERP modernization. Our approach includes a dedicated project manager, joint steering committee, regular status reporting, transparent change control, and collaborative issue management. We ensure timely decision-making, risk mitigation, and executive oversight.'
)

mermaid_code = '''
flowchart TD
  PM[Project Manager] --> Steering[Steering Committee]
  Steering --> ClientPM[Client Project Manager]
  PM --> DevOps[Azure DevOps Setup]
  PM --> Comms[Status Reporting]
  PM --> Risk[Risks & Issues Management]
'''
diagram_path = render_mermaid(mermaid_code, 'governance_workflow')
doc.add_picture(str(diagram_path), width=Inches(5.8))
add_caption('Figure 3: Project management and governance workflow')
doc.add_page_break()

# Security, Privacy, and Compliance

doc.add_heading('Security, Privacy, and Compliance', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Security and privacy are integral. Our methodology includes multi-factor authentication, role-based access, audit logging, and compliance with Kastle’s confidentiality and non-disclosure requirements. All proposal materials are marked confidential; sensitive documents are segregated and clearly labeled.'
)
doc.add_paragraph('We comply with all required legal, insurance, and conflict of interest disclosures. Our proposal is binding for six months and signed by an authorized officer. Standard Master Service Agreement (MSA) and Service Level Agreement (SLA) drafts can be provided upon request.')
doc.add_page_break()

# Team and Qualifications

doc.add_heading('Team and Qualifications', level=1)
para = doc.add_paragraph(
    'Our delivery team comprises senior consultants, architects, and project managers experienced in large-scale ERP and field service system implementations. All resources are credentialed and have direct experience with Microsoft Dynamics migrations.'
)

# Team Structure Table
team_struct = [
    ('Project Sponsor', 'Executive oversight'),
    ('Project Manager', 'Delivery leadership'),
    ('Solution Architect', 'Technical design, integration'),
    ('Business Analyst', 'Requirements, process mapping'),
    ('Technical Consultant', 'Configuration, customization'),
    ('QA Lead', 'Testing, quality assurance'),
    ('Training Lead', 'End user and SME training'),
    ('Data Migration Lead', 'Legacy data conversion'),
    ('Managed Services Lead', 'Post-go-live support')
]
table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=2)
table.style = 'Table Grid'
table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Role'
hdr[1].text = 'Responsibilities'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
for role, resp in team_struct:
    row = table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = role
    row[1].text = resp

doc.add_page_break()

# Assumptions, Risks, and Dependencies

doc.add_heading('Assumptions, Risks, and Dependencies', level=1)
doc.add_paragraph('Key project assumptions:')
doc.add_paragraph('• Kastle will provide access to key stakeholders and environments', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('• Data migration templates and legacy system documentation will be made available', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('• Timely feedback and approvals from Kastle project team', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('• All third-party integrations will be scoped during Analyze phase', style='List Bullet')
doc.add_paragraph('• Training and change management are joint responsibilities', style='List Bullet')

# Risk/Dependency Table
risk_deps = [
    ('Delayed stakeholder access', 'Schedule risk'),
    ('Incomplete legacy data', 'Data migration risk'),
    ('Integration scope changes', 'Potential rework'),
    ('Resource availability', 'Delivery risk'),
    ('Regulatory changes', 'Compliance risk')
]
table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=2)
table.style = 'Table Grid'
table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Risk/Dependency'
hdr[1].text = 'Mitigation'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
for risk, mit in risk_deps:
    row = table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = risk
    row[1].text = mit

doc.add_page_break()

# Pricing Proposal

doc.add_heading('Pricing Proposal', level=1)
pricing_table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=5)
pricing_table.style = 'Table Grid'
pricing_table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = pricing_table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Phase'
hdr[1].text = 'Estimated Low Hours'
hdr[2].text = 'Estimated High Hours'
hdr[3].text = 'Estimated Extended Low Fees'
hdr[4].text = 'Estimated Extended High Fees'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
phase_rows = [
    ('Project Initiation', '', '', '', ''),
    ('Analysis', '', '', '', ''),
    ('Design & Develop', '', '', '', ''),
    ('Deploy', '', '', '', ''),
    ('Optimize', '', '', '', ''),
    ('Total Estimated Consulting Services', 'XX', 'XX', '$XX', '$XX'),
    ('Project Architecture & Governance', 'XX', 'XX', '$XX', '$XX'),
    ('Total Estimated USD Professional Services', 'XX', 'XX', '$XX', '$XX')
]
for rowvals in phase_rows:
    row = pricing_table.add_row().cells
    for idx, val in enumerate(rowvals):
        row[idx].text = val

doc.add_paragraph('All costs are broken down by phase and component. Pricing is transparent and includes one-time and annual ongoing costs for implementation, integration, training, managed services, and support.')
doc.add_page_break()

# Client References

doc.add_heading('Client References', level=1)
doc.add_paragraph('The following are relevant customer references, including projects in the healthcare industry:')
refs = [
    ('Healthcare Organization 1', 'www.healthcare1.com', 'Dynamics 365 ERP implementation, integration with field service and business intelligence platforms, 2022', 'Since 2022'),
    ('Healthcare Organization 2', 'www.healthcare2.com', 'ERP modernization, legacy migration, managed services, 2021', 'Since 2021'),
    ('Manufacturing Company', 'www.manufacturingco.com', 'ERP, warehouse management, and inventory enhancements, 2023', 'Since 2023'),
    ('Distribution Firm', 'www.distributionfirm.com', 'Lead to cash and procure to pay process automation, 2022', 'Since 2022'),
    ('Service Provider', 'www.serviceprovider.com', 'Service management and reporting modernization, 2024', 'Since 2024')
]
ref_table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=4)
ref_table.style = 'Table Grid'
ref_table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = ref_table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Client Name'
hdr[1].text = 'Website'
hdr[2].text = 'Project Information/Details'
hdr[3].text = 'Engagement Since'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
for name, site, info, since in refs:
    row = ref_table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = name
    row[1].text = site
    row[2].text = info
    row[3].text = since

doc.add_page_break()

# Appendices (Compliance Matrix, Responsibilities)

doc.add_heading('Appendices', level=1)
doc.add_heading('Compliance Matrix', level=2)
comp_matrix = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=3)
comp_matrix.style = 'Table Grid'
comp_matrix.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = comp_matrix.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Requirement ID'
hdr[1].text = 'Description'
hdr[2].text = 'Response'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
requirements = [
    ('REQ-001', 'Comprehensive proposal following RFP structure', 'Fully addressed in all sections'),
    ('REQ-002', 'Acknowledge RFP receipt and confirm intent', 'Confirmed in cover letter and schedule'),
    ('REQ-003', 'Participate in discovery sessions', 'Confirmed'),
    ('REQ-004', 'Propose methodology incl. implementation, integration, training, managed services', 'Methodology detailed in Implementation Plan'),
    ('REQ-005', 'Support all major ERP functional areas', 'Table provided in Service Capabilities'),
    ('REQ-006', 'Cost breakdowns, fee structure, pricing transparency', 'Pricing Proposal section'),
    ('REQ-007', 'Submit five relevant customer references, two healthcare', 'Client References section'),
    ('REQ-008', 'Company background, experience, financial stability, insurance, legal actions, conflicts, innovation strategy', 'Company Overview, Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-009', 'Detailed implementation/testing/training/data migration plan, milestones, team, resources', 'Implementation Plan, Team & Qualifications'),
    ('REQ-010', 'Support model, help desk, SLA, scalability', 'Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-011', 'Comply confidentiality/non-disclosure', 'Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-012', 'Mark/segregate confidential materials', 'Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-013', 'Proposal signed/binding for 6 months', 'Cover Letter, Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-014', 'Disclose conflicts, acquisitions, lawsuits, regulatory actions', 'Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-015', 'Include MSA/SLA drafts', 'Security, Privacy & Compliance'),
    ('REQ-016', 'Submit proposal electronically by deadline', 'Cover Letter, Timeline')
]
for reqid, desc, resp in requirements:
    row = comp_matrix.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = reqid
    row[1].text = desc
    row[2].text = resp

doc.add_heading('Responsibilities Matrix', level=2)
resp_table = doc.add_table(rows=1, cols=3)
resp_table.style = 'Table Grid'
resp_table.alignment = WD_TABLE_ALIGNMENT.CENTER
hdr = resp_table.rows[0].cells
hdr[0].text = 'Responsibility'
hdr[1].text = 'Kastle Systems'
hdr[2].text = '[Vendor Company Name]'
for c in hdr:
    for run in c.paragraphs[0].runs:
        run.bold = True
resp_rows = [
    ('Provide project manager empowered for decisions', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Provide management support, resource commitment', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Executive leadership to drive project change', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Access to key business and IT stakeholders', 'X', ''),
    ('Local/global project managers, arrange meetings, review deliverables', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Provide consulting resources', '', 'X'),
    ('Timely review and approval of deliverables', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Implement required business process changes', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Provide data migration templates, validate accuracy', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Provide end-user training', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Provide support during testing', 'X', 'X'),
    ('Post-go-live support', 'X', 'X'),
]
for r, k, v in resp_rows:
    row = resp_table.add_row().cells
    row[0].text = r
    row[1].text = k
    row[2].text = v

doc.add_page_break()

# End of document
